metadata.title: CVE-2016-3115 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - low
metadata.description:
Multiple CRLF injection vulnerabilities in session.c in sshd in OpenSSHbefore 7.2p2 allow remote authenticated users to bypass intendedshell-command restrictions via crafted X11 forwarding data, related to the(1) do_authenticated1 and (2) session_x11_req functions.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-3115` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

openssh-client - 1:7.2p2-4
openssh-client-ssh1 - 1:7.2p2-4
openssh-server - 1:7.2p2-4
openssh-sftp-server - 1:7.2p2-4
ssh - 1:7.2p2-4
ssh-askpass-gnome - 1:7.2p2-4
ssh-krb5 - 1:7.2p2-4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: openssh package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:7.2p2-4').
